item.title: Rubbish strewn everywhere, 17th August
item.description:
As is now usual, rubbish up and down Faversham Road, gathered in the road verges. Please have someone on the cleansing rotation pass through and sort it. Requires daily cleaning as people are just using littering here all the time.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Faversham Road, Beckenham, London

item.description:

item.title: Dead branch on Lime Tree, 17th August
item.description:

item.title: Oil, car debris, soak up pebbles, 17th August
item.description:
Whilst away on holiday, 5th August, there was a serious car crash outside my house. Number 23 Baldwynâ€™s park. On my return The car has been cleared and the lampost chopped halfway but the absolute mess left needs cleaning up asap please. Oil (that smells), the white pebbly dusty product used to cover it, the plastic and metals in the road and street still. Hundreds of small pieces. This could have been cleaned up when they cleared the big bits. The oil needs jet washing off of the pathway or something. Itâ€™s thick and smells on the path. Itâ€™s really unsightly, also when will the wall on the island be rebuilt? The post replaced? It looks awful. I have cleaned up as much as I can on the path, there are 2 bags of the stuff that need taking away. Obviously Iâ€™m not going near the road, itâ€™s unsafe enough having to clean up the path. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Baldwyn's Park, Coldblow, London
Report on FixMyStreet
